title: Day 67 – Black Canyon of the Gunnison NP, CO to Montrose, CO
content:
Best part of camping at the top of a hill? You get to bike back down. Today was more of a rest day than anything, especially since it was downhill the whole way. In the crisp canyon air, we had some applesauce and peanut butter crackers and I did a crossword. We had considered doing a little hike in the morning, but we were in the mood for breakfast and coffee so we rode off instead.

When we got to the top of the hill we’d come up the day before, we felt mightily accomplished. I’ll leave a video here of Tess getting to the top that I forgot to include in the last post.

Thirteen miles and 2500+ feet down, we were in Montrose, Colorado. It seemed like a cool town, though with a little too much car traffic on the main road. We ate breakfast at Daily Bread Bakery, right across from the Republican Party of Montrose building. They had a lot of delicious sweet baked goods that we considered coming back for later. They also had the best homemade peach jam I’ve ever tasted.

Eventually we were drawn to another cafe that had Wifi, as the service was really spotty in town and we had a lot of internet duties to attend to. We ended up at The Coffee Trader, where I ended up spending the next few hours. Tess went to go shopping and get her bangs trimmed, and I just chilled…hard. Waited out a few downpours as well.

Eventually we went to check in at our motel, and got a good shower and nap in. The room was immensely large but had the usual furniture, so there was a huge empty space. We twirled in it.

For dinner we headed back downtown to Colorado Boy Brewery and had a couple really delicious pizzas and a salad. I decided that since we’re in brewery country I should be trying them, so I got a 10oz of their rotating cask beer. It was delightful.

After dinner we went to Cold Stone Creamery to satisfy our sweet tooth. The creamer (?) had a unique laugh that tickled us. I had to throw half mine out because I got too full, then we biked back to the motel and watched Legally Blonde on TV. Probably the third or fourth time we’d caught at least part of it on a hotel TV this trip.
